result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th) and OWI (5th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th) and the other charge, OWI (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David J Ray was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,800.00, costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving six (6) months of Initial Confinement time.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and treatment.  Take all prescribed medications.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department or agent.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form signed and filed.

Provide a biological specimen DNA, to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:    COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 83 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program ONLY after serving 6 Months of Initial Confinement time.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  Pay a fine of $1,800.00 up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  2 Years suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  2 Years Ignition Interlock Device.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Notice of Right to seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant David J Ray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David J Ray in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS T0 COUNTS 1 AND 3:  On motion of the State Court ordered case DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUITLY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, Defendant David J Ray not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David J Ray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David J Ray in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant David J Ray in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant David J Ray in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for David J Ray
Current: 2674 S 13th Street, #7, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 02-04-2015)
Prior: 2811 S 74 St, West Allis, WI 53219
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant David J Ray not in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/27/15 @ 1:30pm
